report.p: Chi’s genre is a cover letter for a Software Engineering position at EMC, a company for which she previously worked as an ADS tester. The object of the piece is to emphasize her interests and abilities relating to the job and to get an interview or get to the next steps of the hiring process.

Chi does a good job in bringing in her previous experience from her co-ops, especially her previous EMC position. Potentially, she should go more in depth with her previous position at EMC and emphasize that she has already been a part of the community and flourished. Adding something like, “I look forward to working for this company again” will grab their attention and reiterate her involvement. Additionally, it would be good if she mentions her nontechnical abilities, such as working in a team and meeting stressful deadlines since those are important qualities in a candidate. I also recommend explaining any personal projects that relates to the skills needed for the position to show that she has a passion for that type of work. If not, then she can list some of her main technical interests or focus areas that tie in. Other than that, rewording some sentences and fixing some grammar would help the flow of the piece (I put some recommendations in).

Overall, cover letters accompany resumes, so I think she should focus on emphasizing what isn’t included on her resume – that is strong personal traits and technical interests. Lastly, cover letters let candidates go more in depth in projects to show the company that they have a strong understanding in their studies, so that would also be good to look into.
